subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4 not working with "extends DBTestCase"
msgSnippet: ... Yes, and have your suite() implementation use the JUnit4TestAdapter, if you re using any JUnit 4-style @Test tags in your subclass.
messageBody:
James Abley wrote:
>
> On 19/06/07, lightbulb432 <veerukrishnan@...
> <mailto:veerukrishnan%40hotmail.com>> wrote:
> >
> > I'm using JUnit 4 from Eclipse, and my test class extends DBTestCase.
> Using
> > annotations and other JUnit 4 features, however, doesn't work from
> Eclipse,
> > which warns that no tests can be found on the class. However, it
> works when
> > I remove extends DBTestCase from my test class.
> >
> > I found an example that uses a @BeforeClass annotation that manually
> calls
> > DBUnit's methods, but I see this as a (hopefully temporary)
> workaround that
> > you might have the right alternative to. How do I integrate DBUnit
> and JUnit
> > 4 from within Eclipse the way it was meant to be used (i.e. no
> workarounds)?
> >
> > Thanks.
>
> Hi,
>
> I think you probably have 2 choices. Wait until DBUnit comes with
> built-in support for JUnit4, similar to how JMock have provided new
> functionality [1]. I don't know if that's on the DBUnit roadmap.
>
> Secondly, use @RunWith to define the Runner that you want to use, so
> that the JUnit3 runner is used.

Yes, and have your suite() implementation use the JUnit4TestAdapter, if
you're using any JUnit 4-style @Test tags in your subclass.
